comments:
Driver: RC2

SWT Application profile fails on Java plugin project that have SWT Plug-in Dependencies. 

This is due to the outdated library packaged in RAC:
swt-awt-win32-3229.dll
swt-gdip-win32-3229.dll
swt-wgl-win32-3229.dll
swt-win32-3229.dll

The following in RC2 driver should be used:
swt-awt-win32-3231.dll
swt-gdip-win32-3231.dll
swt-wgl-win32-3231.dll
swt-win32-3231.dll

This bug should be generic enough for all RAC platform. 
Workaround: 
1. Download swt zip file.
2. Import zip as existing project.
3. Update plugin classpath to the SWT project.
detail: http://www.eclipse.org/swt/eclipse.php

The following error is shown on Window platform:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Can't find library swt-win32-3231  (swt-win32-3231.dll) in sun.boot.library.path or java.library.path
sun.boot.library.path=D:\java_IBM_1.4.2\jre\bin
java.library.path=D:\java_IBM_1.4.2\jre\bin;.;C:\WINNT\system32;C:\WINNT;E:\Program Files\IBM\IBM Agent Controller\bin;D:\java_IBM_1.4.2\jre\bin;E:\Program Files\IBM\IBM Agent Controller\bin;D:\java_IBM_1.3.1\bin;E:\WebSphere5\WebSphere MQ\Java\lib;E:\Program Files\MKStools;C:\WINNT\system32;C:\WINNT;C:\WINNT\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\ATI Technologies\ATI Control Panel;C:\Program Files\IBM\Trace Facility\;C:\Program Files\IBM\Personal Communications\;E:\PROGRA~1\ULTRAE~1;E:\WebSphere5\WebSphere MQ\bin;E:\WebSphere5\WebSphere MQ\WEMPS\bin;e:\Program Files\Rational\common;E:\SQLLIB\BIN;E:\SQLLIB\FUNCTION;E:\SQLLIB\SAMPLES\REPL;E:\Program Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:2019)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:823)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:907)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:18)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:125)
	at swt.plugin.Snippet1.main(Snippet1.java:23)

Thanks to Ali for find the problem!
Note problem does not exist with IAC.

Hubert, Are you packaging the latest SWT dlls from Eclipse SDK used for
building TPTP? If so, did the bug caused by version change for the SWT DLLs
between Eclipse 3.2 M6 and RC2?
Propose to not fix this for Callisto RC2 and RC3. This will be fixed immediately for the nightly builds.
If I don't need to patch the RC2 and RC3 builds for this problem, I don't need to do anything regarding this problem, because the SWT dlls used in the RAC are always the same as the eclipse platform.

Latest SWT dlls are packged according to Hubert. Agent controller packages in TPTP RC2 for Callisto has Eclipse Platform M6 included SWT dlls which are older than Eclipse SDK 3.2 RC2. This will not be fixed in TPTP RC2. It is not a problem starting with RC4.
